definition: anti-nuclear (e.g. protest)
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
pit/stone/nucleus/nuclear/to examine/to check/to verify
variant of 核[he2]/to investigate

sentences.english: An anti-nuclear demonstrator protest in Parliament Square in London March 14, 2007.
sentences.chinese: 英国伦敦国会广场前抗议的反核示威者。

sentences.english: So far, there hasn't been a groundswell of anti-nuclear demonstrations.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止，还没有反核示威浪潮。

sentences.english: Anti-nuclear demonstrators stand in front of a water cannon during a protest outside a nuclear waste storage facility in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 德国核废料存储工厂外举行抗议行游的反核主义者们。

sentences.english: Chapter Three analyses the influence of the Anti-nuclear Peace Movement of Britain.
sentences.chinese: 第三章分析了英国反核和平运动的影响。

sentences.english: Anti-nuclear activists marched in Japan Monday to build momentum for their movement.
sentences.chinese: 反核活动人士星期一在日本游行，为他们的运动造势。

sentences.english: This is the policy favoured by tha antinuclear camp.
sentences.chinese: 这项政策得到了反核阵营的支持。

sentences.english: She was caught up in the anti-nuclear movement.
